EmailTemplate.subject: This Week's Webinar: Containers, Microservices & Why They Matter
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<http://vmturbo.com/vmturbo-resources/microservices-webinar?utm_source=vmturbo&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=MicroservicesWebinar&utm_content=10262015> Hi {{lead.First Name:default=edit me}},
Containers are not new. In fact, their conceptual lineage dates back to the 1970s and chroot jail in UNIX, wherein an application's processes and dependencies were isolated from the rest of the system. In 2014, the genesis of Docker catapulted containers back into the spotlight, as a prospective and seemingly inevitable replacement for their heavier cousins, virtual machines. Containers are orders of magnitude smaller than VMs, bear a fraction of the memory overhead, and can be provisioned in a matter of seconds instead of minutes. As organizations experiment and eventually transition to technologies such as containers and microservices they will inevitably encounter a new set of challenges â€“ This Thursday we'll discuss all these and more on our webinar Containers, Microservices & Why They Matter. During the webinar, we'll cover:
- Which container standard is winning, and which alternatives you should consider
- How containerization and microservices will impact performance through increased East-West traffic
- How microservices trade code complexity for operational complexity, and why you should care
- What VMTurbo is doing to deliver performance control in virtualized, containerized and microservices environments alike
